intro: Eriochilus valens, commonly known as the narrow-leaved everlasting. It is a flowering plant native to southern Australia, belonging to the daisy family, Asteraceae. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats. Eriochilus valens is well adapted to arid conditions and is considered a hardy, low-maintenance plant for gardens.
